titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the J. Warren Perry Collection of Ballet Photographs, circa 1910-1960
Perry (J. Warren) Collection of Ballet Photographs
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2008. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, October 2008.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: J. Warren Perry Collection of Ballet Photographs, circa 1910-1960
did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: A collection of 300 black and white photographs of ballet dancers and choreographers, chiefly from the 1950s. Many of the photographs bear inscriptions to Dr. Perry and a very small number were accompanied by correspondence or clippings.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], J. Warren Perry Collection of Ballet Photographs, circa 1910-1960, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of J. Warren Perry, November 2004.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: The entire collection has been digitized and is available in the UB Libraries Digital Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. J. Warren Perry was born in Richmond, Indiana in 1921. He earned his B.A. at DePauw University in 1944, his Master's at Northwestern University in 1952, and his Ph.D. at Northwestern in 1955. Dr. Perry has been on the faculties at the University of Illinois at Chicago, Northwestern Medical School, and the University of Chicago. He was also employed as deputy assistant commissioner for research and training in the Vocational Rehabilitation Administration at the Department of Health, Education and Welfare in Washington, D.C. Dr. Perry is the founder of the School of Health Related Professions (now the School of Public Health and Health Professions) at the University at Buffalo, The State University of New York. He served as dean of the school from its founding in 1967 until 1977.

Dr. Perry has devoted much of his life to supporting the arts. Before moving to Buffalo he was one of the founders of the Lyric Opera Company in Chicago. Since arriving in Buffalo Dr. Perry has served as chairman or board member for several local organizations, including the Buffalo Philharmonic, Community Music School, Theodore Roosevelt Inaugural National Historic Site, Artpark, and Friends of the Center for the Arts. The numerous awards granted to honor Dr. Perry's contributions to the community include the Buffalo Arts Councils' Supporter of the Arts award, the Buffalo Distinguished Citizen Award, and national Outstanding Philanthropist Award.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The J. Warren Perry Collection of Ballet Photographs, ca. 1910-1960 is a complement to the J. Warren Perry Collection of Photographs, circa 1910-1971. It consists of 300 black and white photographs of many of the most significant ballet dancers of the mid-twentieth century, especially the 1950s. Many of the photographs bear inscriptions from the dancers to Dr. Perry. The collection also contains the photographic work of the most important dance photographers of the first half of the twentieth century, including Herman Mishkin, Witzel, Maurice Seymour, Fred Fehl, Roger Wood, Houston Rogers, Martha Swope, Michael Dunne, George Platt Lynes, and Walter E. Owen.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:

list.item: I. People. Arranged alphabetically by person's name.
II. Productions. Arranged alphabetically by city location.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: J. Warren Perry Collection of Photographs, circa 1910-1971 Mus. Arc. 3.1
defitem.item: Chiefly photographs of opera singers and productions, with additional photographs of other musicians, ensembles, and performing venues.
